subject: Return Order Request
description_text:
Hi,

I would like to request a return for my recent order #SSN1799. Upon testing
the haptics reactor, I noticed that it emits excessively loud noise, even
at the lowest frequency setting, which makes it unusable in my environment.

The item is still in its original packaging, in like-new condition, and I
am contacting you within the 30-day window from the date of delivery. I
believe this may be a manufacturing issue, as the noise level appears
abnormal for expected operation.

Please let me know how to proceed and whether a return shipping label will
be provided. I’m happy to provide photos or video if needed.

Regards,

Tun

conversations.body_text: Hi Jerry Lin,  Please provide a video of use and we will fix it for you please don't worry.

Hi,

Thanks for your reply.

Here’s a video of the unit at 10Hz (lowest setting). I think it may not be
defective, but it’s still far too loud for my setup. I’ve made sure all
screws are tightened and did a few checks, but the noise remains very
noticeable.

Unfortunately, the haptics just doesn’t suit the Simsonn Plus X pedals due
to the excessive noise, so I’d prefer a return and refund instead of a fix.

Please let me know if you can provide a return label.

Best,

Jerry Tun Lin


On Tue, 15 Jul 2025 at 6:53 pm, service@simsonn.com 
Attachment(s) that exceed the 20 MB limit have been dropped. Please reach out to the sender.

Hi Jerry Lin,    The operating sound of the VAM Pro is completely normal and does not require any repair. At 10Hz, the vibration amplitude is larger, making the feedback more noticeable and the sound more prominent. If you prefer quieter operation, we recommend using 30Hz or even 50Hz, which produce less noise.  We have also tested the Simagic HPR, and its operating sound is consistent with that of our VAM Pro.
